page.title: 04North Shropshire Dairy Farm
page.content: The farm belongs to Mr.Kynaston, who has farmed in Crickheath for 32 years. The farm house was built in 1585. The farm is split into two. His partner Brian, who looks after the cows, farms one-half.Mr. Kynaston has three sons who also help on the farm. Mr Kynaston's farm is split into two. Half is pasture land and half is arable. The arable land consists of barley,wheat and silage.Mr Kynaston sells the wheat to a nearby mill.The barley and silage he feeds to his dairy cattle.His land is grade 2-3 for growing crops he would like to have some grade 4 land. He has two types of dairy cattle-Friesians and Herefords. Altogether he has 130 dairy cattle. He also owns two bulls-a Hereford and a Limousin, which is a French breed.
